intro: Hieracium subintegrum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy, rough-textured leaves that help it retain moisture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium subintegrum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
